labels.analysis: The MCP Server is a calculator-focused tool designed to perform a wide range of mathematical operations, from basic arithmetic to advanced forecasting and data summarization. Its tools cater to financial analysis, expense tracking, and predictive modeling, making it particularly useful for applications involving budget management, accounting, and business intelligence. The server's standardization via the Model Context Protocol allows seamless integration with AI applications requiring precise mathematical capabilities.
labels.reasoning: The primary functionality revolves around mathematical calculations and financial analysis, fitting well into the *Data Analysis & Processing* category. Secondary labels include *Financial Services* due to its tools for expense tracking and tax analysis, and *Development Tools* because it enhances AI applications by providing standardized mathematical operations. No custom label is needed as predefined categories adequately cover its functionality.

server_info_crawled.name: Calculator Server
server_info_crawled.author: @rishipradeep-think41/math-mcp
server_info_crawled.overview: Provide a comprehensive set of mathematical calculation tools accessible via the Model Context Protocol. Enable language models to perform arithmetic, trigonometry, logarithms, and other math operations seamlessly. Enhance AI applications with precise and diverse math capabilities through a standardized MCP interface.

tools.name: calculateTotalExpenses
tools.description: Deploy Server Calculator Server @rishipradeep-think41/math-mcp Try in Playground calculateTotalExpenses

tools.name: calculateExpenseGrowthMoM
tools.description: Calculate the month-over-month percentage growth in total expenses. Returns an object mapping YYYY-MM to growth percentage (first month is null).

tools.name: taxImpactAnalysis
tools.description: Calculates the tax paid per transaction (amount_with_tax - amount) and the total tax paid.

tools.name: summarizeExpensesByAccountAndDescription
tools.description: Group and sum expenses by account_name and description (e.g., 'TDS 194C | Payment to vendor').

tools.name: getTopVendorsByExpense
tools.description: Identify vendors with the highest total spending, using description and account_name as the vendor identifier. Returns a sorted array of vendors by total expense.

tools.name: forecastExpensesSimple
tools.description: Forecast future expenses based on historical expense data using exponential smoothing.

tools.name: forecastExpensesArima
tools.description: Forecast future expenses using ARIMA (AutoRegressive Integrated Moving Average) model.

tools.name: calculate_percentage_of
tools.description: Calculates a specified percentage of a given number (e.g., 20% of 150).

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@rishipradeep-think41/math-mcp/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
